channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: With talks teetering, climate negotiators struck a controversial $300 billion deal
item.description: Representatives of developing countries and climate activists were furious over the outcome, saying $300 billion annually from industrialized countries is far short of what vulnerable nations need to better protect themselves from climate change.
item.content:encoded:
Representatives of developing countries and climate activists were furious over the outcome, saying $300 billion annually from industrialized countries is far short of what vulnerable nations need to better protect themselves from climate change.

(Image credit: Sean Gallup/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: In 'Points North' podcast, researchers try to save ash trees from extinction
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Alcohol poisoning deaths in Laos renew concerns about methanol. Here's what to know
item.description: The U.S., Australia and U.K. have issued warnings for travelers in Vang Vieng after several tourists died in a suspected methanol poisoning outbreak.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S., Australia and U.K. have issued warnings for travelers in Vang Vieng after several tourists died in a suspected methanol poisoning outbreak.

(Image credit: Anupam Nath)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump taps Brooke Rollins of America First Policy Institute for agriculture secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Brooke Rollins, head of the America First Policy Institute, to oversee the Department of Agriculture. She has a long history in conservative politics.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Brooke Rollins, head of the America First Policy Institute, to oversee the Department of Agriculture. She has a long history in conservative politics.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Winter storms sweep across the U.S. while a new system is expected for Thanksgiving
item.description: A major storm dropped more snow and record rain in California, while on the opposite side of the country blizzard or winter storm warnings were in effect Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
A major storm dropped more snow and record rain in California, while on the opposite side of the country blizzard or winter storm warnings were in effect Saturday.

(Image credit: Noah Berger)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Infant dies and 10 others sick in latest listeria outbreak tied to ready-to-eat meat
item.description: The cases appeared in California, Illinois, New Jersey and New York between July 31 and Oct. 24, the CDC said. Nine out of the 11 infected individuals were hospitalized.
item.content:encoded:
The cases appeared in California, Illinois, New Jersey and New York between July 31 and Oct. 24, the CDC said. Nine out of the 11 infected individuals were hospitalized.

(Image credit: USDA's Food Safety and Inspection Service)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: NATO head and Trump meet in Florida for talks on global security
item.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and the head of NATO, Mark Rutte, met on Friday in Palm Beach for talks on global security, the military alliance said Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and the head of NATO, Mark Rutte, met on Friday in Palm Beach for talks on global security, the military alliance said Saturday.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Climate change plays a role in global rise of dengue fever
item.description: Over 12 million cases of dengue fever were reported in 2024, the most ever. A study suggests climate change has likely played a significant role in the disease's expansion.
item.content:encoded:
Over 12 million cases of dengue fever were reported in 2024, the most ever. A study suggests climate change has likely played a significant role in the disease's expansion.

(Image credit: Juan Carlos Cisneros)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Opinion: Remembering Vladimir Shklyarov, a dancer for the people
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon remarks on the death of ballet dancer Vladimir Shklyarov. Reports from Russian media say he fell from a 5th floor balcony.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon remarks on the death of ballet dancer Vladimir Shklyarov. Reports from Russian media say he fell from a 5th floor balcony.

(Image credit: OLGA MALTSEVA/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: What a mollusc shell and fiber optic cables have in common
item.description: A heart cockle shell has been found to let in light through a design that resembles fiber optic cables. This could inspire everything from helping coral survive to designing new camera lenses.
item.content:encoded:
A heart cockle shell has been found to let in light through a design that resembles fiber optic cables. This could inspire everything from helping coral survive to designing new camera lenses.

(Image credit: Ruiqi Li)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
